-Hydroxybutyric acid (GHB), also known as 4-hydroxybutanoic acid, is a 
naturally occurring neurotransmitter and a psychoactive drug. Chemically closely 
related to GABA, it acts on the GABA receptor and on the GHB receptor. GHB has 
been used in a medical setting as a general anesthetic, for ..... GHB's sedative 
effects are blocked by GABAB antagonists.

Ketamine, sold under the brand name Ketalar among others, is a medication
